abstract: Mr. Lupton transformed his family bottling business into a piece of the Coca-Cola empire and helped revitalize Chattanooga, Tenn.
snippet: Mr. Lupton transformed his family bottling business into a piece of the Coca-Cola empire and helped revitalize Chattanooga, Tenn.
lead_paragraph: John T. Lupton, who transformed his family bottling business into a big piece of the Coca-Cola soft drink empire and then helped revitalize his native city, Chattanooga, Tenn., died on Sunday at his home in Lookout Mountain, Tenn. He was 83.

headline.main: John T. Lupton, Creator of a Coke-Bottling Empire, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: John T. Lupton, 83, Creator Of a Coke-Bottling Empire

abstract: Twitter, the rapidly expanding microblogging service, planned to have hundreds of advertisers using its new ad system in the fourth quarter as the company ramps up plans to become a self-sustaining, profitable business, Reuters reported.
snippet: Twitter, the rapidly expanding microblogging service, planned to have hundreds of advertisers using its new ad system in the fourth quarter as the company ramps up plans to become a self-sustaining, profitable business, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Twitter, the rapidly expanding microblogging service, planned to have hundreds of advertisers using its new ad system in the fourth quarter as the company ramps up plans to become a self-sustaining, profitable business, Reuters reported.
